abstract: As the stock market bounced back in 2009, so did Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s personal spending, with his his wide-ranging investments turning a tidy profit, The New York Times writes.
snippet: As the stock market bounced back in 2009, so did Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s personal spending, with his his wide-ranging investments turning a tidy profit, The New York Times writes.
lead_paragraph: After a decade of conspicuous consumption — a town house here, a private jet there — Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg seemed to slam on the brakes in 2008 during the recession. He bought no new property, rented out space in a vacation home and — horrors! — cut back on household staff.

headline.main: Bloomberg Spent More as Market Bounced Back
